title: save -d . subds/subsubds takes forever for no good reason

labels.name: performance
labels.description: Improve performance of an existing feature

body:
might be the same underlying issue as of #5283 (didn't analyze details yet)

the intention from running this command, without `-r`, is just to commit as possibly updated state of the sub/subds within hierarchy.  In majority of the cases it might not even be changed in my use case.  But it takes really forever IMHO for no valid reason

```shell
$> datalad --version
datalad 0.14.0.dev46

$> time datalad save -d . -J1  -m 'Fast forward psychoinformatics-de/hirni-toolbox recursively' psychoinformatics-de/
add(ok): psychoinformatics-de (file)
Total (1 skipped):  50%|████████████████████▌                    | 1.00/2.00 [00:00<00:00, 806 datasets/s]
.... was stuck at this already for the duration of me opening new tab, and composing this issue ... will later report output of time
```
NB rate of progress (806 datasets/s is really "funny" given it been stuck for so long having accomplished virtually nothing ;) )

oh -- finally it is "done" with a considerable effort on user and system:

```shell
$> time datalad save -d . -J1  -m 'Fast forward psychoinformatics-de/hirni-toolbox recursively' psychoinformatics-de/
add(ok): psychoinformatics-de (file)
action summary:                                                                                           
  add (ok: 1)
  save (notneeded: 2)
datalad save -d . -J1 -m  psychoinformatics-de/  49.94s user 102.12s system 52% cpu 4:51.77 total
```
